business.headline: New wave of IPOs is coming. Is Dalal Street ready?Tata Capital, PhonePe, and Zepto are also said to be in the pipeline. Financial firms like HDB Financial Services and Hero FinCorp are planning to raise Rs 12,500 crore and Rs 3,668 crore, respectively.

Rakuten to invest over $100 million in India, plans to boost hiring by 8%Rakuten currently employs 4,000 people in India, 90% of whom are tech staff, and plans to recruit people who it considers "power users" of AI.

RBI's raises ATM charges Rs 23 from May 1: Know the details herePeople living in metro cities would get three free transactions per month, while those living in non-metro areas would get five free transactions per month.

Rupee jumps to highest level in 2025. Check factors behind strong rallyThe Indian rupee reached its highest level of 2025, driven by foreign inflows and exporter dollar sales. Optimism over US-India trade talks and a weakening US dollar further supported the currency's rally.

'If we look closely...': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu on finding rural talentZoho's CEO, Sridhar Vembu, believes that India's path to development must include creating jobs and opportunities in smaller towns and villages.

5 Adani stocks get new targets after Q4 results: What should investors do?With Gautam Adani-led Adani Enterprises Ltd set to announce its earnings report soon, stock brokerages have already reviewed the performance of five listed companies from the group and shared fresh price targets and advice for investors.

Varun Beverages Q4 net profit at Rs 726 crore; firm announces interim dividendThe company posted a net profit of Rs 726 crore, up 35% year-on-year, driven by higher volumes and peak-season demand. Revenue for the quarter came in at Rs 5,680 crore, a 29% jump YoY, slightly ahead of most analyst estimates.

Vivad Se Vishwas 2.0 deadline ends today: Last call to settle income tax disputesVivad Se Vishwas 2.0 is a dispute resolution scheme run by the Income Tax Department. It gives taxpayers a chance to settle ongoing tax-related cases by avoiding the prolonged litigation process and simply paying the disputed tax amount.

Akshaya Tritiya 2025: Is falling gold price an opportunity to buy more?Akshaya Tritiya is considered a good day to buy gold. But with gold prices now close to all-time highs, near Rs 96,000 per 10 grams, many buyers are thinking twice before making big purchases this year.
Ather Energy IPO ends today: Should you subscribe or avoid?Ather Energy is struggling to generate investor interest, with sluggish IPO subscription levels and a muted grey market premium.

Bajaj Finance shares tank over 5% after Q4 results. Buy, hold or sell?The stock reacted to a set of numbers that, while solid on paper, failed to match elevated market expectations. In the fourth quarter of FY25, Bajaj Finance reported a 19% year-on-year jump in net profit to Rs 4,546 crore, driven by a 22% rise in net interest income to Rs 9,807 crore.

Explained: Why Bajaj Finserv shares tumbled 6% after Q4 resultsIn its Q4FY25 earnings, Bajaj Finserv reported a 14% year-on-year (YoY) rise in both net profit and revenue, posting Rs 2,417 crore in profit and Rs 36,595 crore in revenue.

Gold price falls further as easing trade tensions dampen appealSpot gold was down 0.2% at $3,308.32 an ounce, as of 0242 GMT. US gold futures GCcv1 lost 0.5% to $3,317.50. The dollar edged 0.1% higher against a basket of currencies, making bullion more expensive for overseas buyers.

IndusInd Bank share price falls nearly 3% after CEO resignsSumant Kathpalia's resignation marks a dramatic turn in the bank's ongoing troubles related to internal derivatives trades that were improperly accounted for, raising questions about internal oversight and risk management.
Sensex, Nifty recover early losses as FII inflows lift market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex added 83.58 points to 80,371.96, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 18.70 points to 24,354.65 as of 9:45 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock markets to rise or fall today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,323.5 at 8:10 am. This suggests that Nifty50 will likely start the day close to Tuesday's closing level of 24,335.95.

Stocks to watch on April 30: Infosys, IndusInd Bank, Adani Power, Ola ElectricThough there were worries about border tensions with Pakistan that weighed on investor sentiment, foreign investors continued to buy Indian shares, and global markets gave positive signals.
Mother Dairy raises milk prices by up to Rs 2 per litreThe price revision will be effective from April 30, 2025 across its market, a company official said on Tuesday.

IndusInd Bank CEO Sumant Kathpalia resigns after derivatives accounting lapseThe accounting lapse, which pertained to internal derivative trades, had a negative impact on the bank's profit and loss statement and its net worth. In his resignation letter, Kathpalia wrote, "I undertake moral responsibility, given the various acts of commission/omission that have been brought to my notice."

Tata plant begins iPhone production in India as Apple pivots from tariff-hit ChinaThe new Tata facility in Hosur, southern India, has begun rolling out older iPhone models on a single production line. Meanwhile, Foxconn's upcoming $2.6 billion factory in Karnataka's capital is expected to start trial production of the iPhone 16 series shortly, sources told the news agency.

Osamu Suzuki conferred with Padma Vibhushan for contribution to auto industryOsamu Suzuki, former Chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation and ex-Director & Honorary Chairman of Maruti Suzuki India Limited, was posthumously honoured with the Padma Vibhushan, the country's second-highest civilian award.

Sensex, Nifty close flat after volatile trade as border tensions weigh on marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 70 points to close at 80,288.38, while the NSE Nifty50 just managed to end in green, adding 7.45 points to close at 24,335.95.

Sebi probes Ola Electric's sales data disclosures: ReportThe matter came into focus after a big gap was seen between the vehicle registration data on the government's VAHAN portal and the sales numbers shared by the company.

Terror's price tag: How the Pahalgam attack could hit Pakistan's economyAlready struggling with a weak economy, Pakistan now faces even tougher times ahead as India's retaliatory steps threaten to break crucial economic links.

Infosys sacks 195 trainees over failed internal tests: ReportThe move marks the fourth such round of trainee terminations at India's second-largest IT services company, which is grappling with weak demand and flat revenue projections for the current fiscal year.

Dalal Street faces high volatility, but there is good news for investorsBy mid-morning, the Sensex was up around 100 points and holding above 80,302, while the Nifty50 traded above 24,300. That resilience marks a big shift from just a few weeks ago when even a whisper of bad news could send stocks crashing.
Explained: Why are gold prices not rising any moreGlobally, gold prices also dropped nearly 1%. Spot gold was down 0.8% at $3,314.99 an ounce, while US gold futures lost 0.7% to $3,325.10.

Ather Energy IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription details, GMP and key datesAther Energy IPO Day 2: The IPO will remain open till April 30, giving investors a couple more days to weigh their options. Ather's offering is a combination of fresh shares and an offer-for-sale from existing investors.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 52-week low after ED raids officesGensol ED raid: The company's stock continued to face heavy selling pressure, falling to Rs 81.36, which is its 52-week low. Gensol shares have now lost over 50% of their value in the last one month and nearly 90% over the past six months.

Explained: Why Tata Motors, Samvardhana Motherson and other auto stocks are risingBy 9:50 am, Tata Motors shares were up 1.2% at Rs 676.45, while Samvardhana Motherson gained 1.4% to Rs 136.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. Although some of the early gains were trimmed by profit booking, the auto sector stood out in an otherwise cautious market. Sona BLW shares were trading 3.2% higher at Rs 478.10.

Reliance shares are gaining momentum after strong Q4. Can the rally last?Following the Q4 result announcement, RIL stock jumped nearly 5%. Even today, the stock has jumped 1.5% in early trade. Now the question is: is this just a relief rally — or the start of something bigger?

Sensex, Nifty extend winning run boosted by FII buying; Tata Motors gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 419.40 points to 80,637.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 122.45 points to 24,450.95 as of 9:24 am.

Ather Energy IPO: Looking to invest? Check latest subscription and GMPThe price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 304 and Rs 321 per share. Retail investors need to apply for a minimum of one lot, which consists of 46 shares.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty likely to continue their rally. Here's whyGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,484.5 as of 7:16 am, showing that the Nifty50 is likely to start the day higher than Monday's closing level of 24,328.5.

Stocks to watch today: Bajaj Finance, IndusInd Bank, Wipro, Adani Green, GensolSeveral companies, including Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, Bharat Petroleum Corporation, Ambuja Cements, etc are set to announce their fourth-quarter (Q4) results.

No bribes, no queues: Founder compares business setup in Dubai vs IndiaSharing his story on Reddit, the founder said he recently set up a business in one of Dubai's free zones and was amazed at how smooth the whole process was.

Want higher FD returns? RBL and Union Bank offer up to 8.5% to select customersAfter the latest revision, Union Bank of India now offers FD interest rates ranging from 3% to 7.15% for regular customers, depending on the deposit tenure (7 days to 10 years).

Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu calls AI's impact on jobs 'small'Vembu pointed out that while AI vendors are promising big changes, real-world studies, including one titled 'Large Language Models, Small Labor Market Effects', show a different picture.

Sensex, Nifty surge over 1% as Reliance rally and FII buying lift marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to close at 80,218.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 289.15 points to end at 24,328.50.

Trump's tariffs are raising recession fears. How bad could it get?Just three months ago, economists covering nearly 50 economies had forecast a steady, healthy pace of global growth. But Trump's decision to slap sweeping tariffs, including a 10% blanket duty on all US imports and a 145% tariff on goods from China, has upset those expectations.

entertainment.headline: Ajith Kumar hospitalised after minor leg injury in ChennaiActor Ajith Kumar has been hospitalised in Chennai after his return from New Delhi. The actor suffered a minor injury at the Chennai airport on Tuesday night.

Now You See Me 3 trailer: Jesse Eisenberg returns with his Horsemen for another heistThe 'Now You See Me 3' trailer has been released, reuniting the original cast with some new additions. Fans are in for a thrilling ride as the Four Horsemen take on a new heist.

It's a high-risk profession: Emraan Hashmi on emotional toll of playing BSF jawanIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Emraan Hashmi shared his experience of preparing for the role of a BSF officer in 'Ground Zero'. The actor talked about the physical and emotional challenges he faced during the filming

Costao movie review: Nawazuddin Siddiqui holds half-baked film about unsung heroReleased-Wed Apr 30, 2025In 'Costao', Nawazuddin Siddiqui plays an honest customs officer who is caught in the web of power and politics and is robbed of eight years of life after being accused of murder. While the actor performs fabulously, the story doesn't hold on its own despite being inspired by a heroic real-life incident.

Mouni Roy on botched surgery claims: People are writing rubbish, vicious thingsActor Mouni Roy recently responded to trolls who accused her of having cosmetic surgery, saying she feels sorry for them.

Content creator Misha Agrawal died by suicide, reveals sisterContent creator Misha Agrawal died by suicide just before her 25th birthday, her sister revealed. She shared that Misha had been under immense pressure due to decline in her social media followers.

Apoorva Mukhija says parents 'lost respect in a second': I put them through thatApoorva Mukhija became emotional in a promo for her interview with We Are Yuvaa, discussing the backlash from the India's Got Latent controversy.

Actor Shine Tom Chacko admitted to de-addiction centre amid drug abuse claimsMalayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko has been admitted to a rehab centre following drug abuse allegations by co-star Vincy Aloshious. He was earlier arrested and released on bail.
Housefull 5 teaser: Akshay Kumar's laugh riot gets a killer twist this timeAkshay Kumar's family entertainer, 'Housefull 5' teaser is finally out. The film will release in theatres on June 6.

Deepika Padukone-SRK to reunite for 5th time in King, shooting details out: ReportShah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone seem to be paired together for the fifth time. The two will reportedly be seen alongside Suhana Khan in her debut film 'King'.

Javed Akhtar on Pakistani artistes in India: At this moment, I would say noVeteran screenwriter and lyricist Javed Akhtar shared his views on whether Pakistani artistes should be allowed to perform in India. He stated that it's a 'one-way traffic'.

Neha Kakkar refused to perform for just '700 people' in Melbourne: Event plannerSinger Neha Kakkar allegedly refused to perform at the Melbourne concert. One of the event organisers claimed that she wasn't satisfied with the turnout of 700 people and wanted to wait till the stadium filled up.

Kesari 2 box office Day 12: Akshay's film Rs 70 crore strong; Rs 100 crore possible?'Kesari Chapter 2' is doing well during the weekdays, and while it is already Rs 70 crore strong, it will be interesting to see if it manages to surpass the benchmark of Rs 100 crore by the end of this weekend or next week.

Thunderbolts review: Marvel's fun filler till the next Avenger dropsReleased-Thu May 01, 2025Florence Pugh simply stole the show with her performance in 'Thunderbolts*'.  The film offers a mix of entertainment and depth, making it a worthwhile addition to the franchise. Read our review.

Ajith credits wife Shalini for his success: There were times I took wrong decisionsActor Ajith Kumar, in an exclusive interview with India Today, credited his wife Shalini for his success. He stated that she stood by him even when he took wrong decisions.

TikTok's Delaney Rowe sparks romance buzz with actor B.J. NovakB.J. Novak and TikTok star Delaney Rowe are rumoured to be dating after multiple public sightings, though reps haven't confirmed. Fans on social media continue speculating about their relationship status.

First Look: Dwayne Johnson unrecognizable as Mark Kerr in The Smashing MachineDwayne Johnson transforms to play MMA legend Mark Kerr in The Smashing Machine, a gritty A24 sports drama exploring fame, addiction, and resilience. The film hits theaters October 3, 2025.

Ken Carson announces 2025 Arena tour after 'More Chaos' tops Billboard 200Following his chart-topping album More Chaos, Ken Carson announces a 30-city North American arena tour starting July 2025, marking a milestone moment in his rapidly rising hip-hop career.

Sam Asghari debuts romance with Brooke Irvine at LGBTQ+ Hotel OpeningSam Asghari debuted his relationship with Brooke Irvine at a Puerto Vallarta LGBTQ+ hotel launch, expressing allyship, joining stars like Demi Lovato, and reflecting on life post-Britney Spears.

general news.headline: Exclusive video of India's most wanted Hafiz Saeed's top-security Lahore homeIndia Today has accessed satellite pictures and videos that show how India's most wanted terrorist is living a comfortable life in Lahore under tight security by the Pakistani government.

PM's 'super cabinet' meets just after top security body huddle over J&K attack  Live UpdatesPrime Minister Narendra Modi chaired key Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) and Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs (CCPA) meetings today amid tensions with Pakistan after the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

Security advisory board revamped after Pahalgam attack, ex-RAW chief to head itThe move to revamp the National Security Advisory Board comes in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terrorist attack and amid tensions with Pakistan.

Pakistan turns panicistanIndia's display of resolve after the Pahalgam terror attacks in which 26 people were killed has spread panic among Pakistan's military and civilian authorities. The panic mode is on full display as Islamabad scurries officials to several world capitals, moves terrorists nourished by it into bunkers, pleads for a neutral probe and rushes forces to the border with India.

When Kashmir turned crimson with blood of PanditsIn part 3 of our series on the history of terror in Kashmir, we revisit the winter of 1989, when the blood of Kashmiris flowed through the Valley, leading to the biggest exodus in Independent India.
PM Modi to skip Victory Day celebrations in Russia on May 9: ReportPM Modi not to attend Victory Day celebrations in Russia on May 9: News agency Reuters quoting Kremlin
Deven Bharti, who led 26/11 attacks probe, is new Mumbai police commissionerA 1994 batch IPS officer from Bihar, Deven Bharti has been serving as the Mumbai Police special commissioner since 2023.

Hindu ho kya? Tourist recalls chilling encounter day before Pahalgam carnageTwenty-six people, mostly tourists, were killed and several were injured when terrorists opened fire at a meadow near the popular tourist town of Pahalgam in south Kashmir's Anantnag district on April 22.

Costao movie review: Nawazuddin Siddiqui holds half-baked film about unsung heroReleased-Wed Apr 30, 2025In 'Costao', Nawazuddin Siddiqui plays an honest customs officer who is caught in the web of power and politics and is robbed of eight years of life after being accused of murder. While the actor performs fabulously, the story doesn't hold on its own despite being inspired by a heroic real-life incident.

Class 10 ICSE, Class 12 ISC results declared. Direct link to download scorecardsCISCE ISC Class 12th, ICSE Class 10th Result 2025 Direct Link at cisce.org, results.cisce.org Live Updates: The websites to check and access the CISCE 2025 Class 10 and Class 12 results are cisce.org and DigiLocker. The CISCE Class 10 and Class 12 result rechecking window will be activated after the declaration of results today.

UK says India has 'full support' to go after perpetrators of Pahalgam attackAsked about "cross-border links to Pakistan" in the Pahalgam terror attack, British Foreign Minister Hamish Falconer said, "We want to see the perpetrators held to justice properly, and we will be supporting India to do so."

Shaadi without a couple? Welcome to Delhi's fake wedding party sceneDelhi's party scene has a new trend: fake weddings. Guests dress in ethnic wear, dance to dhol beats, and celebrate. No couple or vows needed, just the vibe.

Javed Akhtar on Pakistani artistes in India: At this moment, I would say noVeteran screenwriter and lyricist Javed Akhtar shared his views on whether Pakistani artistes should be allowed to perform in India. He stated that it's a 'one-way traffic'.

How Pak got terror outfit's name dropped from UN statement on Pahalgam attackPakistani Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar said as a non-permanent member of the UN Security Council, Islamabad pushed to water down the language in the US-proposed statement, which originally named and shamed The Resistance Front.

Think Bihar breeds IAS toppers? This state outsmarts itUP's larger population base, broader access to educational resources, and longer history of administrative participation have given it a consistent edge.

Google CEO Sundar Pichai's security cost the company over Rs 67 crore in 2024Google is reportedly paying big bucks for CEO Sundar Pichai's security, and it has no problem doing so. According to the company, paying over $8 million (approx Rs 67 crore) is reasonable and necessary.

Kuldeep Yadav playfully slaps Rinku Singh on live TV. His reaction goes viralDelhi Capitals' spinner Kuldeep Yadav slapped Rinku Singh on live TV after the DC vs KKR match on Tuesday, April 29. Rinku was taken aback by the playful slap from Kuldeep and stared at him with a look of bewilderment in his eyes.

Job applicant questions hiring process, recruiter replies, 'You failed as a human'A job applicant questioned the hiring process of a startup publicly, and the recruiter blasted him with a stern reply. The now-viral face-off has sparked debate online.

Digital access fundamental right: Top court on KYC norms for acid attack victimsThe Supreme Court issued a slew of directions to ease banking and e-governance services for acid attack survivors with visual challenges.

Supreme court frees woman who killed daughters under 'invisible power's influence'The Supreme Court highlighted the lack of a clear motive behind the mother killing her children, while also acknowledging her claim of having acted under the influence of an 'invisible power'.

Watch: Elderly woman tries to enter cockpit, gets knocked to ground by crewChaos broke out on an American Airlines flight when a woman tried to storm the cockpit over a delay. She was tackled by crew and was later removed by police. The incident delayed the flight from São Paulo to New York by over 2 hours.

Supreme Court halts Delhi High Court order on law entrance exam result revisionThe Common Law Admission Test (CLAT), 2025, for admissions to five-year LLB courses in national law universities, was held on December 1, 2024, and results were declared on December 7. CLAT determines admissions to undergraduate and postgraduate law courses in national law universities in the country.

Now You See Me 3 trailer: Jesse Eisenberg returns with his Horsemen for another heistThe 'Now You See Me 3' trailer has been released, reuniting the original cast with some new additions. Fans are in for a thrilling ride as the Four Horsemen take on a new heist.

Taking back POK only solution: India-born British MP on Pahalgam horrorIndian-origin British politician, Lord Meghnad Desai, has urged the Indian government to take over Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK) to resolve the longstanding Kashmir issue permanently. Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 innocent civilians, Desai emphasised that reclaiming the POK is the only way to solve the problem.

sports.headline: Rare ball-hitting talents: Manjrekar names his top young battersThe new generation of power-hitters in the IPL has impressed former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar. In his column, Manjrekar has named his top young batters this season.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi maiden IPL hundred: F1 driver Oscar Piastri praises RR batterFormula One driver Oscar Piastri heaped praise on Vaibhav Suryavanshi after his record-breaking hundred against GT. Suryavanshi shattered many records and his efforts pleased Piastri.

Virat Kohli's brother takes a dig at Sanjay Manjrekar after IPL strike-rate talkVirat Kohli's brother has taken a jibe at Sanjay Manjrekar after his talk about strike-rates in IPL 2025. Manjrekar has been praising the young batters for their fearless approach.

PSG coach praises 'Titan' Donnarumma after team closes in on UCL finalParis Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique praised the team's goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma after the match. Donnaruma made crucial stops as PSG beat Arsenal 1-0 in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final.

Arsenal will need to do something special in Paris to reach UCL final: ArtetaMikel Arteta feels that his Arsenal side will need to do something special in Paris to make it to the final of the Champions League after their home loss to PSG.

Delhi Capitals suffering due to inconsistent top-order: Shaun PollockDelhi Capitals have dropped form in IPL 2025 due to their inconsistent batting order, said Shaun Pollock after the team's match against Kolkata Knight Riders. DC have lost 3 of their last 4 games.

Harshit needs to step up for KKR, he's not a newcomer anymore: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra feels that Harshit Rana needs to step up for KKR in the ongoing season of IPL 2025. The former cricketer said that Harshit isn't a newcomer anymore and needs to repay the faith Kolkata has put in him.

Rohit Sharma birthday: Yuvraj Singh, RCB and CSK lead the way with wishesThe cricketing world and fans wished Rohit Sharma on his 38th birthday on Wednesday, April 30. Rohit continues to show his class during the IPL 2025 season.

He has nothing to prove: Gilchrist wants MS Dhoni to retire from IPLFormer Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist has said that MS Dhoni should retire from the Indian Premier League next season. Gilchrist stated that Dhoni should call time on his career because he has nothing left to prove.

Narine single-handedly brought KKR back in the game vs DC: Anukul RoyIPL 2025: KKR spinner Anukul Roy praised Sunil Narine for single-handedly winning their match against Delhi Capitals. Narine picked up three wickets and scored a quickfire 27 runs to hand KKR and important victory in the IPL.

Harshit needs to step up for KKR, he's not a newcomer anymore: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra feels that Harshit Rana needs to step up for KKR in the ongoing season of IPL 2025. The former cricketer said that Harshit isn't a newcomer anymore and needs to repay the faith Kolkata has put in him.

Rohit Sharma birthday: Yuvraj Singh, RCB and CSK lead the way with wishesThe cricketing world and fans wished Rohit Sharma on his 38th birthday on Wednesday, April 30. Rohit continues to show his class during the IPL 2025 season.

He has nothing to prove: Gilchrist wants MS Dhoni to retire from IPLFormer Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist has said that MS Dhoni should retire from the Indian Premier League next season. Gilchrist stated that Dhoni should call time on his career because he has nothing left to prove.

Narine single-handedly brought KKR back in the game vs DC: Anukul RoyIPL 2025: KKR spinner Anukul Roy praised Sunil Narine for single-handedly winning their match against Delhi Capitals. Narine picked up three wickets and scored a quickfire 27 runs to hand KKR and important victory in the IPL.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
